author: bridge-bot

<etan_status> the signature_slot determines the signing sync committee

if attested_slot is from an earlier sync committee, you already have to know the next sync committee in order to validate the message, so it doesnt make sense to include the same sync committee as part of the update

content:
<cryptodavidw> > if attested_slot is from an earlier sync committee, you already have to know the next sync committee in order to validate the message

I think I'm confused as to why there is both an attested and a finalized header, and why they can be in different sync period. Isn't the finalized_header the one that matters here and that should be verifiyable with your current sync committee?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> the attested_header is the one being signed

the signature_slot is the slot at which the sig was made (usually attested +1 but can be more)

the finalized header is the finalized_checkpoint.rootat attested_header.beacon.state_root

its documented in the consensus-specs repo

author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> re: **@cryptodavidw**
> perhaps from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85MeiMA4dD8 I understand that the sync committee signs a block, which is a parent of the attested_header, which is a parent of the finalized_header
slot number increases from left to right.

the sync committee signature is included in the red block to the right.

it signs the parent block (blue / attested_header)

that one's post state_root has a finalized_checkpoint.root that refers to the green block.

green block < blue block < red block.

everything up to the green block is finalized (meaning, there is only a single canonical chain / no more reorgs).

everything up to the blue block is attested (meaning, the sync committee believes it will become canonical, but there may still be reorgs).

the red block just contains the signature, but it was not signed itself yet (so we cannot assume it is valid yet)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> finalized is an ancestor of attested (about ~64-96 slots between normally)

attested is the parent of the signature block
